response_requirements.initial_response_description: Records Access Officer must respond within 10 business days (excludes Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, or days when office closed unexpectedly)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Initial 10-day response may include fee estimate; additional 15 business days allowed after payment for record production (25 days total)
response_requirements.extension_notes: 15 additional business days allowed after payment of fee estimate for complex requests

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Enhanced 2017 law established limits on fees charged; specific fee structure varies by agency under regulatory framework
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Reasonable fees permitted; 2017 enhancements limited fees for public records

exemptions.description: Various exemptions established in state law

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Primary appeal authority located in Office of Secretary of the Commonwealth; has authority to order compliance
appeal_process.second_level_notes: Civil action in Superior Court available after Supervisor of Records appeal or directly
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Potential damages and attorney fees for violations

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Any person may request public records; no requirement to state purpose
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: No specific format required; should identify records with reasonable specificity
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must sufficiently identify desired records

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Each agency and municipality must designate Records Access Officer (RAO) to coordinate responses and assist requesters
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Records provided in requested format when feasible; Secretary of Commonwealth provides request portal for state agencies
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Construed in favor of public access
agency_obligations.training_notes: Supervisor of Records provides guidance materials

oversight_body.name: Supervisor of Records, Office of Secretary of the Commonwealth
oversight_body.role: Primary appeal authority for denied requests; has authority to order compliance; provides guidance and regulations
oversight_body.contact_info: State House, Room 337, Boston, MA 02133; Phone: (617) 727-2832; Email: pre@sec.state.ma.us

primary_sources: Supervisor of Records public records guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Massachusetts statute. Response timeline: 10 business days for initial response (excludes weekends, holidays, unexpected closures); additional 15 business days allowed after payment for complex requests (25 days total). Mandatory Records Access Officer (RAO) designation required. Two-level appeal process: Supervisor of Records (primary authority with compliance ordering power), then Superior Court. Attorney fees and damages available for violations. Enhanced in 2017 with 'An Act to Improve Public Records' effective January 1, 2017, which established fee limitations and strengthened access rights. Comprehensive regulatory framework under 940 CMR 11, 950 CMR 32-33. Secretary of Commonwealth provides request portal for state agencies.
